message_1:
A salesman has to travel to 5 different cities and return to his home city. What is the shortest possible route he can take to visit all cities only once and return home? The distances between the cities are as follows:

City A to B: 10km
City A to C: 12km
City A to D: 15km
City A to E: 8km
City B to C: 11km
City B to D: 8km
City B to E: 14km
City C to D: 6km
City C to E: 9km
City D to E: 10km

What is the total distance he will have to travel?
message_2:
To find the shortest possible route, we can use the brute force method by listing all possible routes and calculating their total distances. Since there are 5 cities to visit, there are 4! (4 factorial) or 24 possible routes. Here are the possible routes and their total distances:

1. A-B-C-D-E-A: 10+11+6+10+8 = 45
2. A-B-C-E-D-A: 10+11+9+10+15 = 55
3. A-B-D-C-E-A: 10+8+6+9+8 = 41

7. A-C-B-D-E-A: 12+11+8+10+8 = 49

12. A-C-E-D-B-A: 12+9+10+8+10 = 49

13. A-D-B-C-E-A: 15+8+11+9+8 = 51
14. A-D-B-E-C-A: 15+8+14+9+12 = 58
15. A-D-C-B-E-A: 15+6+11+14+8 = 54
16. A-D-C-E-B-A: 15+6+9+14+10 = 54
17. A-D-E-B-C-A: 15+10+14+11+12 = 62
18. A-D-E-C-B-A: 15+10+9+11+10 = 55

19. A-E-B-C-D-A: 8+14+11+6+15 = 54
20. A-E-B-D-C-A: 8+14+8+6+12 = 48

24. A-E-D-C-B-A: 8+10+6+11+10 = 45

The shortest possible route is A-B-D-C-E-A with a total distance of 41 km.
